alert.note: Alert for Adams; Wells (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 25 at 9:41PM EDT until March 28 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana... Tippecanoe River near Ora affecting Fulton IN, Kosciusko, Pulaski, Starke and Marshall Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... Wabash River near Linn Grove affecting Adams and Wells Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wabash River near Linn Grove. * WHEN...Until Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Agricultural flooding begins. Low lands east of Geneva begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 PM EDT Saturday the stage was 10.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 11.0 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage Monday morning. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Never drive vehicles through flooded areas. The water may be too deep to allow safe passage. Never allow children to play in or near flood waters. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio or local media for further statements and updated forecasts. Detailed river forecasts and additional information can be found at www.weather.gov/iwx under Rivers and Lakes. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
